channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Euro to Fall Further in Coming Months; Parity Versus Dollar Is a Risk
item.description: The euro fell, and is expected to fall further against the dollar, Rabobank said, adding that it could even drop to parity.

item.title: 'Back to Starbucks' Could Have a Retro Feel---and Valuation
item.description: New boss Brian Niccol got some bad news out of the way early, but bringing back the Starbucks of old will come with a lower price tag.

item.title: ‘Being divorced, I want to look out for her’: I gave my daughter $100K for a house. She’s buying a new home with her husband. What happens to my gift?
item.description: “They have now been married for six years.”

item.title: Wall Street Is Finding New Ways to Slice and Dice Loans
item.description: Goldman sold $475 million of a first-of-its-kind deal with public asset-backed securitization bonds backed by “capital-call” loans.

item.title: Another billionaire investor positions for a Trump win. He’s placing ‘inflation trades.’
item.description: Legendary investor Paul Tudor Jones said Tuesday he’s moved his portfolio in the direction of a victory by Donald Trump in the Nov. 5 presidential ele...

item.title: Treasury yields rising on potential ‘red wave’ election result that pushes up deficit
item.description: Billionaires are betting against U.S. government bonds. But yields are climbing on good news about the economy, too.

item.title: A messy election could end market’s era of ‘American exceptionalism’
item.description: “We can envision a post-election scenario where uncertainty rises and trust in U.S. institutions declines,” Macquarie strategist Thierry Wizman said.

item.title: This ETF has trounced the S&P 500 with bets on AI in a surprising sector
item.description: Macrae Sykes of Gabelli Funds explains his strategy, which looks beyond the Nvidia-focused AI hardware buildout.

item.title: Oil Slips Amid U.S. Crude Stocks Build Report, Middle East Uncertainties
item.description: Oil prices slipped in early European trade on reports of a U.S. crude stockpiles build and as markets monitor developments in the Middle East.

item.title: Europe's Gas Prices Gain on Near-Term Risks
item.description: European natural-gas prices continued to rise in late morning trade, boosted by geopolitical risks, production outages and prospects of a potentially ...
